it.polimi.deib.newdem.adrenaline.view.server

Class VirtualTurnView

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.newdem.adrenaline.view.server.VirtualTurnView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TurnListener, TurnView

    public class VirtualTurnView
extends java.lang.Object
implements TurnView, TurnListener
    A virtual view is a view object that acts as an adapter between model/controller and views, translating the model objects into plain data objects usable by views. This way the view is completely separated from the model and we do not need to clone/reflect model objects into the client. Note: the VirtualGameView is also used to give information about the in-game users to the other virtual views.

      • choosePayment

        public TurnView.ValOrUndo<PaymentReceiptData> choosePayment(PaymentInvoice invoice,
                                                            AmmoSet playerInv,
                                                            java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> cardIDs,
                                                            int fragmentToPay)
        Description copied from interface: TurnView
        Asks the user to choose a payment. The user can reject the payment (returning null), or choose what to use to pay, among ammos and power ups.
        Specified by:
        choosePayment in interface TurnView
        Parameters:
        invoice - The PaymentInvoice object representing the price.
        playerInv - An AmmoSet object containing the ammos that the player can use to pay.
        cardIDs - The ID of the power ups that can be used to pay
        fragmentToPay - An ID specifying what the user is going to pay.
        Returns:
